node.title: 'It's awesome': Kaikōura locals ready to dive for pāua after 5 years
node.description: Five years after the earthquake which devastated seabeds along the Kaikōura coastline, people are once again able to gather pāua from its shores.

node.title: One in three employees high risk for burnout during pandemic
node.description: Workplace burnout is soaring as workers find it harder to balance their work life with pressures from the Covid-19 pandemic.

node.title: January 6 committee recommends contempt for former DOJ official
node.description: The panel voted unanimously to recommend that the House find Jeffrey Clark in contempt of Congress.

node.title: Music legend Clarence Avant's wife shot and killed in Beverly Hills home
node.description: The 81-year-old, known for her philanthropy work in the Los Angeles area, died early Wednesday morning.

node.title: Here are all the charges against the suspect in the Oxford High School shooting.
node.description: The 15-year-old suspect faces 24 felony counts, including terrorism causing death.

node.title: Possible Contempt Charge Hangs Over Trump Justice Dept. Official
node.description: The House committee investigating the Capitol riot agreed to delay action against Jeffrey Clark until after he could be interviewed again.

node.title: Suspect in Michigan School Shooting Faces Murder and Terrorism Charges
node.description: A 15-year-old accused of killing four of his classmates and wounding seven other people had described wanting to attack the school in cellphone videos and a journal, the authorities said.

node.title: $71.5M Compensation Fund Announced for Women Abused By Doctor, Including Andrew Yang's Wife
node.description: The settlement was agreed to by 79 women who accused former gynecologist Robert Hadden, and the two hospitals where he worked, of partaking in abuse.

node.title: Suspect in Deadly Waukesha Parade Crash Says in Interview He Feels 'Demonized' in Jail
node.description: "I just feel like I'm being monster – demonized," the suspect said.

node.title: Catholic Church Cancels YAF-Sponsored Anti-Abortion Talk by Matt Walsh as Faculty Protest
node.description: The Young America's Foundation found a new venue for Walsh's appearance after St. Francis Xavier College Church cancelled the event.

node.title: Biden Scoffs When Asked if He Thinks Trump Put Him at Risk of COVID at Presidential Debate
node.description: Three days after his first debate against Biden, Trump announced on Twitter that he and his wife had tested positive for coronavirus.

node.title: Families of Astrowold crush turn down Travis Scott's offer to pay for funerals
node.description: Attorneys for the families of four of the victims of the Astroworld Festival crush say they have received a letter from performer Travis Scott's attorney, Daniel Petrocelli, in which an offer was made to pay for the funerals of their lost loved ones.

node.title: Meet the nearby black holes that are set to collide and create a 'monster'
node.description: Astronomers have discovered a pair of supermassive black holes that are the closest to Earth ever observed – and they're on a collision course with each other.

node.title: Alex Carey confirmed as Australian wicketkeeper for first two Ashes Tests
node.description: South Australia's Alex Carey will be Australia's wicketkeeper for at least the first two Ashes Tests, after he is added to the squad in place of former skipper Tim Paine.

node.title: International student devastated by border delay, as agency warns students may study elsewhere
node.description: Chitra Mukherjee has not seen her husband for almost two years due to border closures. She is desperate for the borders to re-open and is devastated the timeline has been pushed back.

node.title: First COVID-19 case recorded in remote NT community of Lajamanu, bringing Katherine cluster to 60
node.description: One new local case of COVID-19 has been recorded in the Northern Territory overnight, in the remote community of Lajamanu. It is the first case to be recorded in that community.

node.title: Northland needs more time to get vaccination levels up - DHB chair
node.description: A Northern District Health Board leader says the region needs more time to boost low vaccination rates before unvaccinated travellers are allowed in. Audio

node.title: Pilot practising stalling before fatal crash - CAA report
node.description: Pilots are being urged to keep their flying skills up to date or seek more training following a fatal crash near Twizel last year.

node.title: Christchurch bus services to be reduced due to driver shortage
node.description: MetroBus announced one of their operators does not have enough staff to continue operating the weekday timetable.

node.title: Two taken into custody after knife fight on streets of Waikato town
node.description: Two people were taken into custody after a man with a machete was caught on camera pacing around a busy Tuakau street, yelling at another man.

node.title: Dilworth School's former chaplain Ross Douglas Browne jailed
node.description: One of Dilworth's most prolific child sex offenders has been sentenced to six and a half years in jail.

node.title: Nonprofit seeks to provide millions of coats for children in need
node.description: In the past 23 years, Operation Warm has manufactured more than 4 million coats for children in need.

node.title: Man testifies that Jussie Smollett paid him to "fake beat him up"
node.description: Smollett, 39, faces six counts of disorderly conduct and is accused of lying to police about the 2019 incident.

node.title: Chris Cuomo Has a Funny Idea About What Doing His Job Means
node.description: Reporting on the suspension of a brotherly TV host.

node.title: Canada Goose workers vote to unionize in Winnipeg.
node.description: After a decisive election, about 1,200 employees of the parka maker will be represented by an affiliate of the Service Employees International Union.

node.title: CNN and Chris Cuomo Face Difficult Questions After Anchor’s Suspension
node.description: The network said it was pursuing a “further evaluation” of evidence regarding its star anchor’s efforts to help stave off a sexual harassment scandal that his brother, former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, was facing.

node.title: Supreme Court Seems Poised to Uphold Mississippi’s Abortion Law
node.description: It was less clear whether the court’s conservative majority would overrule Roe v. Wade, the decision establishing a constitutional right to abortion.

node.title: Roberts Searches for Middle Ground in Abortion Case
node.description: The chief justice, known for his incremental approach to contentious issues, explored on Wednesday whether the court could uphold Mississippi’s law without totally throwing out Roe v. Wade.

node.title: U.S. Reports Its 1st Omicron Case, in a California Traveler
node.description: The discovery in San Francisco County prompted the Biden administration to renew calls for everyone to get fully vaccinated and receive a booster, if eligible.

node.title: Abortion Decision Could Spill Into Midterm Elections
node.description: Both sides anticipate that a Supreme Court decision scaling back abortion rights would roil next year’s elections, with Democrats sensing an advantage.
